exec: pm.test('User object has required fields', function () {

request.description:
## Documentation

### Description
Retrieves a list of all users in the system. Returns an array of user objects with their details. Soft-deleted users are excluded from the results.

### Notes
- No authentication required
- Returns all active users only (soft-deleted users excluded)
- Response follows ResponseTrait standard format
- Users are returned using UserResource for consistent formatting

### Request
- **URL**: `{{base_url}}/api/users`
- **Method**: `GET`
- **Content-Type**: `application/json`

### Response

#### Response Structure
| Key | Type | Description |
|-----|------|-------------|
| key | string | Response status key, always "success" for 200 |
| msg | string | Response message in Arabic, default "تم بنجاح" |
| data | array | Array of user objects |

#### User Object Structure
| Key | Type | Description |
|-----|------|-------------|
| id | integer | User unique identifier |
| name | string | User full name (max 50 characters) |
| email | string | User email address (unique, valid email format) |
| phone | string | User phone number (max 20 characters) |
| created_at | string | Formatted creation timestamp (Y-m-d H:i:s) |

#### Example Response (200 OK)
```json
{
    "key": "success",
    "msg": "تم بنجاح",
    "data": [
        {
            "id": 1,
            "name": "John Doe",
            "email": "john.doe@example.com",
            "phone": "1234567890",
            "created_at": "2026-01-30 10:00:00"
        },
        {
            "id": 2,
            "name": "Jane Smith",
            "email": "jane.smith@example.com",
            "phone": "0987654321",
            "created_at": "2026-01-30 10:00:00"
        }
    ]
}
```

#### Status Codes
- `200 OK`: Success - Returns array of users
- `400 Bad Request`: Failure - Error message in response

## Documentation

### Description
Retrieves a single user by their unique identifier. Returns the user object with all their details. If the user is not found or has been soft-deleted, an error response is returned.

### Notes
- No authentication required
- Returns 400 error if user not found
- Response follows ResponseTrait standard format
- User is returned using UserResource for consistent formatting

### Request
- **URL**: `{{base_url}}/api/users/{id}`
- **Method**: `GET`
- **Content-Type**: `application/json`
- **URL Parameters**:
  | Parameter | Type | Required | Description |
  |-----------|------|----------|-------------|
  | id | integer | Yes | User unique identifier |

### Response

#### Response Structure
| Key | Type | Description |
|-----|------|-------------|
| key | string | Response status key, always "success" for 200 |
| msg | string | Response message in Arabic, default "تم بنجاح" |
| data | object | User object |

#### User Object Structure
| Key | Type | Description |
|-----|------|-------------|
| id | integer | User unique identifier |
| name | string | User full name (max 50 characters) |
| email | string | User email address (unique, valid email format) |
| phone | string | User phone number (max 20 characters) |
| created_at | string | Formatted creation timestamp (Y-m-d H:i:s) |

#### Example Response (200 OK)
```json
{
    "key": "success",
    "msg": "تم بنجاح",
    "data": {
        "id": 1,
        "name": "John Doe",
        "email": "john.doe@example.com",
        "phone": "1234567890",
        "created_at": "2026-01-30 10:00:00"
    }
}
```

#### Status Codes
- `200 OK`: Success - Returns user object
- `400 Bad Request`: Failure - User not found or error message

formdata.description: User full name. Required. Must be a string with maximum 50 characters.
User email address. Required. Must be a valid email format. Must be unique (excluding soft-deleted users).
User phone number. Required. Must be a string with maximum 20 characters.
User password. Required. Must be a string with minimum 8 characters. Will be automatically hashed.

request.description:
## Documentation

### Description
Creates a new user in the system. All fields are required. The email must be unique (excluding soft-deleted users). The password will be automatically hashed before storage.

### Notes
- No authentication required
- Email must be unique (excluding soft-deleted users)
- Password is automatically hashed
- Response follows ResponseTrait standard format
- User is returned using UserResource for consistent formatting

### Request
- **URL**: `{{base_url}}/api/users`
- **Method**: `POST`
- **Content-Type**: `multipart/form-data`

#### Body Parameters
| Key | Type | Required | Validation Rules |
|-----|------|----------|-----------------|
| name | string | Yes | Required, string, max:50 |
| email | string | Yes | Required, email format, unique (excluding soft-deleted) |
| phone | string | Yes | Required, string, max:20 |
| password | string | Yes | Required, string, min:8 |

### Response

#### Response Structure
| Key | Type | Description |
|-----|------|-------------|
| key | string | Response status key, always "success" for 200 |
| msg | string | Response message in Arabic, default "تم بنجاح" |
| data | object | Created user object |

#### User Object Structure
| Key | Type | Description |
|-----|------|-------------|
| id | integer | User unique identifier |
| name | string | User full name (max 50 characters) |
| email | string | User email address (unique, valid email format) |
| phone | string | User phone number (max 20 characters) |
| created_at | string | Formatted creation timestamp (Y-m-d H:i:s) |

#### Example Response (200 OK)
```json
{
    "key": "success",
    "msg": "تم بنجاح",
    "data": {
        "id": 1,
        "name": "John Doe",
        "email": "john.doe@example.com",
        "phone": "1234567890",
        "created_at": "2026-01-30 10:00:00"
    }
}
```

#### Status Codes
- `200 OK`: Success - User created and returned
- `400 Bad Request`: Failure - Error message in response
- `422 Unprocessable Entity`: Validation errors - Laravel validation error structure

response.name: Error - Validation Failed

formdata.description: User full name. Optional. Must be a string with maximum 50 characters. Only include if updating this field.
User email address. Optional. Must be a valid email format. Must be unique (excluding current user). Only include if updating this field.
User phone number. Optional. Must be a string with maximum 20 characters. Only include if updating this field.
User password. Optional. Must be a string with minimum 8 characters. Will be automatically hashed. Only include if updating this field.

request.description:
## Documentation

### Description
Updates an existing user by their unique identifier. All fields are optional - only include the fields you want to update. The email must be unique (excluding the current user). The password will be automatically hashed if provided.

### Notes
- No authentication required
- All fields are optional (use 'sometimes' validation)
- Email must be unique (excluding current user)
- Password is automatically hashed if provided
- Response follows ResponseTrait standard format
- User is returned using UserResource for consistent formatting

### Request
- **URL**: `{{base_url}}/api/users/{id}`
- **Method**: `PUT`
- **Content-Type**: `multipart/form-data`
- **URL Parameters**:
  | Parameter | Type | Required | Description |
  |-----------|------|----------|-------------|
  | id | integer | Yes | User unique identifier |

#### Body Parameters
| Key | Type | Required | Validation Rules |
|-----|------|----------|-----------------|
| name | string | No | Sometimes, string, max:50 |
| email | string | No | Sometimes, email format, unique (excluding current user) |
| phone | string | No | Sometimes, string, max:20 |
| password | string | No | Sometimes, string, min:8 |

### Response

#### Response Structure
| Key | Type | Description |
|-----|------|-------------|
| key | string | Response status key, always "success" for 200 |
| msg | string | Response message in Arabic, default "تم بنجاح" |
| data | object | Updated user object |

#### User Object Structure
| Key | Type | Description |
|-----|------|-------------|
| id | integer | User unique identifier |
| name | string | User full name (max 50 characters) |
| email | string | User email address (unique, valid email format) |
| phone | string | User phone number (max 20 characters) |
| created_at | string | Formatted creation timestamp (Y-m-d H:i:s) |

#### Example Response (200 OK)
```json
{
    "key": "success",
    "msg": "تم بنجاح",
    "data": {
        "id": 1,
        "name": "John Doe Updated",
        "email": "john.updated@example.com",
        "phone": "9876543210",
        "created_at": "2026-01-30 10:00:00"
    }
}
```

#### Status Codes
- `200 OK`: Success - User updated and returned
- `400 Bad Request`: Failure - User not found or error message
- `422 Unprocessable Entity`: Validation errors - Laravel validation error structure

response.name: Error - Validation Failed

request.description:
## Documentation

### Description
Soft deletes a user by their unique identifier. The user is not physically removed from the database but marked as deleted. All associated accounts are also soft-deleted. The user will be excluded from future queries.

### Notes
- No authentication required
- Performs soft delete (not physical deletion)
- All associated accounts are also soft-deleted
- User will be excluded from future queries
- Response follows ResponseTrait standard format

### Request
- **URL**: `{{base_url}}/api/users/{id}`
- **Method**: `DELETE`
- **Content-Type**: `application/json`
- **URL Parameters**:
  | Parameter | Type | Required | Description |
  |-----------|------|----------|-------------|
  | id | integer | Yes | User unique identifier |

### Response

#### Response Structure
| Key | Type | Description |
|-----|------|-------------|
| key | string | Response status key, always "success" for 200 |
| msg | string | Response message in Arabic: "تم حذف المستخدم بنجاح" |
| data | array | Empty array |

#### Example Response (200 OK)
```json
{
    "key": "success",
    "msg": "تم حذف المستخدم بنجاح",
    "data": []
}
```

#### Status Codes
- `200 OK`: Success - User soft-deleted
- `400 Bad Request`: Failure - User not found or error message
